qas.question: What was banned in Switzerland in 1955 after the Le Mans disaster?
Who voted to overturn the ban on motorsport events in June 2007?
Who rejected the  2007 vote to overturn the motorsport ban in Switzerland?
Which successful World Touring Car Championship driver was produced in Switzerland despite the ban on motorsport events?
Which Swiss motorcycle racer won the 2005 MotoGP World Championship in the 125cc category?

context: <a0_0>Motorsport racecourses and events<a0_0/> were banned in Switzerland following the 1955 Le Mans disaster with exception to events such as Hillclimbing. During this period, the country still produced successful racing drivers such as Clay Regazzoni, Sebastian Buemi, Jo Siffert, Dominique Aegerter, successful World Touring Car Championship driver <a3_0>Alain Menu<a3_0/>, 2014 24 Hours of Le Mans winner Marcel Fässler and 2015 24 Hours Nürburgring winner Nico Müller. Switzerland also won the A1GP World Cup of Motorsport in 2007–08 with driver Neel Jani. Swiss motorcycle racer <a4_0>Thomas Lüthi<a4_0/> won the 2005 MotoGP World Championship in the 125cc category. In June 2007 the <a1_0>Swiss National Council<a1_0/>, one house of the Federal Assembly of Switzerland, voted to overturn the ban, however the other house, the <a2_0>Swiss Council of States<a2_0/> rejected the change and the ban remains in place.
